overview:
Dennis Doughty serves as Vice President of Engineering at JumpTap. With nearly two decades of experience in the high tech industry, Mr. Doughty has extensive experience in software architecture, interface design, strategic planning and project management.

Before JumpTap, Mr. Doughty served as Vice President of Engineering for Pantero where he spearheaded development of the company’s groundbreaking semantic integration suite. Prior to Pantero, Mr. Doughty served as Vice President of Engineering at Lycos. In this role, he led a global team responsible for the content and architecture of major Lycos Network properties, including Lycos Search, HotBot, and MyLycos. Prior to Lycos, Mr. Doughty served as Director of Engineering at Grasp Information Corporation, where he was responsible for the company’s flagship knowledge management system, and at Interleaf, Inc., where he directed the company’s document management offerings. Mr. Doughty has also held senior engineering positions at Inter national Lisp Associates and Symbolics, Inc.
